value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Filename

value.description: The password for the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Password

value.description: The Type of the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Type

value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the Truststore
value.name: Truststore Filename

value.description: The password for the Truststore
value.name: Truststore Password

value.description: The Type of the Truststore. Either JKS or PKCS12
value.name: Truststore Type

value.description: The algorithm to use for this SSL context
value.name: SSL Protocol

value.description: The port to listen on for communication.
value.name: Port

value.description: The size of each buffer used to receive messages. Adjust this value appropriately based on the expected size of the incoming messages.
value.name: Receive Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum size of the internal queue used to buffer messages being transferred from the underlying channel to the processor. Setting this value higher allows more messages to be buffered in memory during surges of incoming messages, but increases the total memory used by the processor.
value.name: Max Size of Message Queue

value.description: The maximum size of the socket buffer that should be used. This is a suggestion to the Operating System to indicate how big the socket buffer should be. If this value is set too low, the buffer may fill up before the data can be read, and incoming data will be dropped.
value.name: Max Size of Socket Buffer

value.description: Specifies the character set of the received data.
value.name: Character Set

value.description: The maximum number of concurrent TCP connections to accept.
value.name: Max Number of TCP Connections

value.description: The maximum number of messages to add to a single FlowFile. If multiple messages are available, they will be concatenated along with the <Message Delimiter> up to this configured maximum number of messages
value.name: Max Batch Size

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to place between messages when multiple messages are bundled together (see <Max Batch Size> property).
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context. If this property is set, messages will be received over a secure connection.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The client authentication policy to use for the SSL Context. Only used if an SSL Context Service is provided.
value.name: Client Auth

value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Log Level to use when logging the Attributes
value.name: Log Level

value.description: If true, the FlowFile's payload will be logged, in addition to its attributes; otherwise, just the Attributes will be logged.
value.name: Log Payload

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to Log. If not specified, all attributes will be logged.
value.name: Attributes to Log

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to ignore. If not specified, no attributes will be ignored.
value.name: Attributes to Ignore

value.name: Log prefix

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The size of the file that will be used
value.name: File Size

value.description: The number of FlowFiles to be transferred in each invocation
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: Specifies whether the data should be Text or Binary
value.name: Data Format

value.description: If true, each FlowFile that is generated will be unique. If false, a random value will be generated and all FlowFiles will get the same content but this offers much higher throughput
value.name: Unique FlowFiles

value.description: The scheme for connecting to Splunk.
value.name: Scheme

value.description: The ip address or hostname of the Splunk server.
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The port of the Splunk server.
value.name: Port

value.description: The query to execute. Typically beginning with a <search> command followed by a search clause, such as <search source="tcp:7689"> to search for messages received on TCP port 7689.
value.name: Query

allowableValues.description: The processor will manage the date ranges of the query starting from the beginning of time.
The processor will manage the date ranges of the query starting from the current time.
The the time range provided through the Earliest Time and Latest Time properties will be used.

value.description: Indicates how to apply time ranges to each execution of the query. Selecting a managed option allows the processor to apply a time range from the last execution time to the current execution time. When using <Managed from Beginning>, an earliest time will not be applied on the first execution, and thus all records searched. When using <Managed from Current> the earliest time of the first execution will be the initial execution time. When using <Provided>, the time range will come from the Earliest Time and Latest Time properties, or no time range will be applied if these properties are left blank.
value.name: Time Range Strategy

value.description: The value to use for the earliest time when querying. Only used with a Time Range Strategy of Provided. See Splunk's documentation on Search Time Modifiers for guidance in populating this field.
value.name: Earliest Time

value.description: The value to use for the latest time when querying. Only used with a Time Range Strategy of Provided. See Splunk's documentation on Search Time Modifiers for guidance in populating this field.
value.name: Latest Time

value.description: The Splunk Application to query.
value.name: Application

value.description: The owner to pass to Splunk.
value.name: Owner

value.description: The token to pass to Splunk.
value.name: Token

value.description: The username to authenticate to Splunk.
value.name: Username

value.description: The password to authenticate to Splunk.
value.name: Password

value.description: The security protocol to use for communicating with Splunk.
value.name: Security Protocol

value.description: The output mode for the results.
value.name: Output Mode

relationships.description: Results retrieved from Splunk are sent out this relationship.
relationships.name: success

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The ip address or hostname of the destination.
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The port on the destination.
value.name: Port

entry.key: Max Size of Socket Send Buffer

value.description: The maximum size of the socket send buffer that should be used. This is a suggestion to the Operating System to indicate how big the socket buffer should be. If this value is set too low, the buffer may fill up before the data can be read, and incoming data will be dropped.
value.displayName: Max Size of Socket Send Buffer
value.name: Max Size of Socket Send Buffer

value.description: Specifies the character set of the data being sent.
value.name: Character Set

value.description: The timeout for connecting to and communicating with the destination. Does not apply to UDP
value.name: Timeout

value.description: The amount of time a connection should be held open without being used before closing the connection.
value.name: Idle Connection Expiration

value.description: The protocol for communication.
value.name: Protocol

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context. If this property is set, messages will be sent over a secure connection.
value.name: SSL Context Service

entry.key: Max Size of Socket Send Buffer

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed to send to the destination are sent out this relationship.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that are sent successfully to the destination are sent out this relationship.
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

entry.value: <10> ${now():format("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'")} localhost this is a test message ${now()}

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success
